verses.kjv: Now Jericho was straitly shut up because of the children of Israel: none went out, and none came in.
verses.ct: Jericho was completely locked down because of the Israelites — no one left the city, and no one entered it.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, See, I have given into thine hand Jericho, and the king thereof, and the mighty men of valour.
verses.ct: The LORD told Joshua, "Look, I have given you victory over Jericho, its king, and its powerful warriors.

verses.kjv: And ye shall compass the city, all ye men of war, and go round about the city once. Thus shalt thou do six days.
verses.ct: All your fighting men must march around the city, circling it once. Do this for 6 days.

verses.kjv: And seven priests shall bear before the ark seven trumpets of rams’ horns: and the seventh day ye shall compass the city seven times, and the priests shall blow with the trumpets.
verses.ct: 7 priests will carry 7 ram's horn trumpets in front of the ark. On the 7th day, march around the city 7 times while the priests blow the trumpets.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that when they make a long blast with the ram’s horn, and when ye hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout; and the wall of the city shall fall down flat, and the people shall ascend up every man straight before him.
verses.ct: When you hear a long blast from the ram's horn — when the trumpet sounds — all the people must let out a massive shout. The city wall will collapse completely, and everyone will charge straight ahead into the city."

verses.kjv: And Joshua the son of Nun called the priests, and said unto them, Take up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the LORD.
verses.ct: Joshua son of Nun summoned the priests and told them, "Pick up the ark of the covenant, and have 7 priests carry 7 ram's horn trumpets ahead of the ark of the LORD."

verses.kjv: And he said unto the people, Pass on, and compass the city, and let him that is armed pass on before the ark of the LORD.
verses.ct: Then he told the people, "Move out and march around the city. The armed soldiers will go ahead of the ark of the LORD."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Joshua had spoken unto the people, that the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams’ horns passed on before the LORD, and blew with the trumpets: and the ark of the covenant of the LORD followed them.
verses.ct: After Joshua gave these instructions to the people, the 7 priests carrying the 7 ram's horn trumpets marched ahead of the LORD, blowing the trumpets, and the ark of the covenant of the LORD followed behind them.

verses.kjv: And the armed men went before the priests that blew with the trumpets, and the rereward came after the ark, the priests going on, and blowing with the trumpets.
verses.ct: The armed soldiers marched in front of the priests who were blowing the trumpets, and the rear guard followed behind the ark, with the priests continually blowing the trumpets as they went.

verses.kjv: And Joshua had commanded the people, saying, Ye shall not shout, nor make any noise with your voice, neither shall any word proceed out of your mouth, until the day I bid you shout; then shall ye shout.
verses.ct: Joshua had given the people strict orders: "Don't shout. Don't make a sound. Don't let a single word come out of your mouths until the day I tell you to shout. Then you will shout."

verses.kjv: So the ark of the LORD compassed the city, going about it once: and they came into the camp, and lodged in the camp.
verses.ct: So the ark of the LORD was carried around the city, circling it once. Then they returned to camp and spent the night there.

verses.kjv: And Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up the ark of the LORD.
verses.ct: Joshua got up early the next morning, and the priests picked up the ark of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And seven priests bearing seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark of the LORD went on continually, and blew with the trumpets: and the armed men went before them; but the rereward came after the ark of the LORD, the priests going on, and blowing with the trumpets.
verses.ct: The 7 priests carrying the 7 ram's horn trumpets marched steadily ahead of the ark of the LORD, blowing the trumpets as they went. The armed soldiers marched in front of them, and the rear guard followed behind the ark of the LORD, with the trumpets blowing continuously.

verses.kjv: And the second day they compassed the city once, and returned into the camp: so they did six days.
verses.ct: On the 2nd day they marched around the city once and returned to camp. They did this for 6 days.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they rose early about the dawning of the day, and compassed the city after the same manner seven times: only on that day they compassed the city seven times.
verses.ct: On the 7th day, they got up at dawn and marched around the city in the same way — but this time they circled it 7 times. That was the only day they marched around the city 7 times.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the seventh time, when the priests blew with the trumpets, Joshua said unto the people, Shout; for the LORD hath given you the city.
verses.ct: On the 7th time around, as the priests blew the trumpets, Joshua commanded the people, "Shout! The LORD has given you the city!

verses.kjv: And the city shall be accursed, even it, and all that are therein, to the LORD: only Rahab the harlot shall live, she and all that are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent.
verses.ct: The city and everything in it must be completely devoted to the LORD for destruction. Only Rahab the prostitute and everyone with her in her house will be spared, because she hid the scouts we sent.

verses.kjv: And ye, in any wise keep yourselves from the accursed thing, lest ye make yourselves accursed, when ye take of the accursed thing, and make the camp of Israel a curse, and trouble it.
verses.ct: But be very careful — stay away from the things set apart for destruction. If you take any of those things, you will bring destruction and disaster on the entire camp of Israel.

verses.kjv: But all the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, are consecrated unto the LORD: they shall come into the treasury of the LORD.
verses.ct: However, all the silver, gold, and items made of bronze and iron are set apart as holy to the LORD. They must go into the LORD's treasury."

verses.kjv: So the people shouted when the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.
verses.ct: So the people shouted as the priests blew the trumpets. When the people heard the trumpet blast and let out a massive shout, the wall collapsed completely. Every man charged straight ahead, and they captured the city.

verses.kjv: And they utterly destroyed all that was in the city, both man and woman, young and old, and ox, and sheep, and ass, with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: They completely destroyed everything in the city with the sword — men and women, young and old, cattle, sheep, and donkeys.

verses.kjv: But Joshua had said unto the two men that had spied out the country, Go into the harlot’s house, and bring out thence the woman, and all that she hath, as ye sware unto her.
verses.ct: Joshua had told the 2 men who had scouted the land, "Go to the prostitute's house and bring her out along with everyone belonging to her, just as you promised her."

verses.kjv: And the young men that were spies went in, and brought out Rahab, and her father, and her mother, and her brethren, and all that she had; and they brought out all her kindred, and left them without the camp of Israel.
verses.ct: So the young scouts went in and brought out Rahab, along with her father, her mother, her brothers, and everyone else belonging to her. They brought out all her relatives and placed them outside the Israelite camp.

verses.kjv: And they burnt the city with fire, and all that was therein: only the silver, and the gold, and the vessels of brass and of iron, they put into the treasury of the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: Then they burned the entire city and everything in it. The only things they kept were the silver, gold, and items of bronze and iron, which they placed in the treasury of the LORD's house.

verses.kjv: And Joshua saved Rahab the harlot alive, and her father’s household, and all that she had; and she dwelleth in Israel even unto this day; because she hid the messengers, which Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
verses.ct: But Joshua spared Rahab the prostitute, her father's household, and everyone belonging to her. She has lived among the Israelites to this day, because she hid the scouts that Joshua sent to investigate Jericho.

verses.kjv: And Joshua adjured them at that time, saying, Cursed be the man before the LORD, that riseth up and buildeth this city Jericho: he shall lay the foundation thereof in his firstborn, and in his youngest son shall he set up the gates of it.
verses.ct: At that time Joshua made this solemn declaration: "Cursed in the LORD's sight is anyone who rebuilds this city of Jericho. It will cost him his firstborn son to lay its foundation, and his youngest son to set up its gates."

verses.kjv: So the LORD was with Joshua; and his fame was noised throughout all the country.
verses.ct: The LORD was with Joshua, and his reputation spread throughout the entire land.
